alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 28 at 12:30PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PERIODS OF BLOWING SNOW FOR THE ANCHORAGE HILLSIDE AND SEWARD HIGHWAY... Gusty winds across the Anchorage hillside and along the Seward Highway corridor along Turnagain Arm will produce brief periods of blowing snow with the higher wind gusts, which could reduce visibilities. Please use caution while traveling. A secondary wave will bring more snow on Wednesday morning, with moderate uncertainty regarding the location of the heaviest bands. Additional snowfall of 2 to 4 inches is expected through Wednesday night, though locally higher amounts are possible, especially along the Anchorage Hillside. Fluffy, loose snow could lead to higher snow totals. Forecast snow amounts may change as this low progresses east. Please check back for the latest forecast.
